# The `GetElementPtrInst` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

## Description {#details}

an instruction for type-safe pointer arithmetic to access elements of arrays and structs

Definition at line 933 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>.

### GetElementPtrInst() {#a31e4d4f6836731b131932d7cdc89e974}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>llvm::GetElementPtrInst::GetElementPtrInst (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; PointeeType, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; Ptr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; &gt; IdxList, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/user/allocinfo">AllocInfo</a> AllocInfo, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; NameStr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/insertposition">InsertPosition</a> InsertBefore)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Constructors - Create a getelementptr instruction with a base pointer an list of indices.

The first and second ctor can optionally insert before an existing instruction, the third appends the new instruction to the specified <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h/#l00943">943</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Functions

### accumulateConstantOffset() {#acd203d07a075c5a33492609ef8f3643e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool GetElementPtrInst::accumulateConstantOffset (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; Offset) const</>}>
Accumulate the constant address offset of this GEP if possible.

This routine accepts an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> into which it will accumulate the constant offset of this GEP if the GEP is in fact constant. If the GEP is not all-constant, it returns false and the value of the offset <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> is undefined (it is <em>not</em> preserved!). The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> passed into this routine must be at least as wide as the IntPtr type for the address space of the base GEP pointer.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h/#l01120">1120</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp/#l01581">1581</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp">Instructions.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

hasAllConstantIndices - Return true if all of the indices of this GEP are constant integers.

  labels = {["static"]}>
Returns the result type of a getelementptr with the given source element type and indexes.

Null is returned if the indices are invalid for the specified source element type.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h/#l01011">1011</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp/#l01514">1514</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp">Instructions.cpp</a>.

### getTypeAtIndex() {#a056eabb719f475aa4c5a7e2ba11973b9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Type &#42; GetElementPtrInst::getTypeAtIndex (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; Idx)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return the type of the element at the given index of an indexable type.

This is equivalent to &quot;getIndexedType(Agg, &#123;Zero, Idx&#125;)&quot;.

Returns null if the type can&#39;t be indexed, or the given index is not legal for the given type.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h/#l01020">1020</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp/#l01474">1474</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp">Instructions.cpp</a>.
